t: Isaiah 40
The Greatness of God
“Comfort,*pn O comfort My people,” says your God.
“Speak*ln kindly to Jerusalem; And*ln call out to her, that her warfare has ended, That*ln her iniquity has been removed, That*ln she has received of the Lord’s*s hand Double*ln for all her sins.”
A*ln voice is calling, “Clear*ln the way for the Lord*s in the wilderness; Make*ln smooth in the desert a highway for our God.
Let*ln every valley be lifted up, And*ln every mountain and hill be made low; And*ln let the rough ground become a plain, And*ln the rugged terrain a broad valley;
Then*ln the glory of the Lord*s will be revealed, And*ln all flesh will see it*i together; For*ln the mouth of the Lord*s has spoken.”
A*ln voice says, “Call out.” Then*ln he answered, “What shall I call out?” All*ln flesh is grass, and all its loveliness is like the flower of the field.
The*ln grass withers, the flower fades, When*ln the breath of the Lord*s blows upon it; Surely*ln the people are grass.
The*ln grass withers, the flower fades, But*ln the word of our God stands forever.

Get*ln yourself up on a high mountain, O*ln Zion, bearer of good news, Lift*ln up your voice mightily, O*ln Jerusalem, bearer of good news; Lift*ln it*i up, do not fear. Say*ln to the cities of Judah, “Here*ln is your God!”
Behold,*ln the Lord God*s will come with might, With*ln His arm ruling for Him. Behold,*ln His reward is with Him And*ln His recompense before Him.
Like*ln a shepherd He will tend His flock, In*ln His arm He will gather the lambs And*ln carry them*i in His bosom; He*ln will gently lead the nursing ewes.*i

Who*ln has measured the waters in the hollow of His hand, And*ln marked off the heavens by the span, And*ln calculated the dust of the earth by the measure, And*ln weighed the mountains in a balance And*ln the hills in a pair of scales?
Who*ln has directed the Spirit of the Lord,*s Or*ln as His counselor has informed Him?
With*ln whom did He consult and who*i gave Him understanding? And*ln who*i taught Him in the path of justice and taught Him knowledge And*ln informed Him of the way of understanding?
Behold,*ln the nations are like a drop from a bucket, And*ln are regarded as a speck of dust on the scales; Behold,*ln He lifts up the islands like fine dust.
Even*ln Lebanon is not enough to burn, Nor*ln its beasts enough for a burnt offering.
All*ln the nations are as nothing before Him, They*ln are regarded by Him as less than nothing and meaningless.
To*ln whom then will you liken God? Or*ln what likeness will you compare with Him?
As*iln for*i the idol, a craftsman casts it, A*ln goldsmith plates it with gold, And*ln a silversmith fashions*i chains of silver.
He*ln who is too impoverished for such*i an offering Selects*ln a tree that does not rot; He*ln seeks out for himself a skillful craftsman To*ln prepare an idol that will not totter.
Do*ln you not know? Have you not heard? Has*ln it not been declared to you from the beginning? Have*ln you not understood from the foundations of the earth?
It*ln is He who sits above the circle of the earth, And*ln its inhabitants are like grasshoppers, Who*ln stretches out the heavens like a curtain And*ln spreads them out like a tent to dwell in.
He*ln it*i is*i who reduces rulers to nothing, Who*ln makes the judges of the earth meaningless.

Scarcely*ln have they been planted, Scarcely*ln have they been sown, Scarcely*ln has their stock taken root in the earth, But*ln He merely blows on them, and they wither, And*ln the storm carries them away like stubble.
“To*ln whom then will you liken Me That*ln I would be his*i equal?” says the Holy One.

Lift*ln up your eyes on high And*ln see who has created these stars,*i The*ln One who leads forth their host by number, He*ln calls them all by name; Because*ln of the greatness of His might and the strength of His*i power, Not*ln one of*i them*i is missing.
Why*ln do you say, O Jacob, and assert, O Israel, “My*ln way is hidden from the Lord,*s And*ln the justice due me escapes the notice of my God”?
Do*ln you not know? Have you not heard? The*ln Everlasting God, the Lord,*s the Creator of the ends of the earth Does*ln not become weary or tired. His*ln understanding is inscrutable.
He*ln gives strength to the weary, And*ln to him*i who*i lacks might He increases power.
Though*ln youths grow weary and tired, And*ln vigorous young men stumble badly,
Yet*ln those who wait for the Lord*s Will*ln gain new strength; They*ln will mount up with*i wings like eagles, They*ln will run and not get tired, They*ln will walk and not become weary.
